fields.headline: Encephalitis epidemic kills more than 1,000
fields.bodyText: More than 1,000 people have been killed during an outbreak of Japanese encephalitis across India and Nepal, officials said yesterday. The death toll from the mosquito-borne disease, which causes swelling of the brain, reached 1,054 after Nepalese officials reported that 271 people had died in the Himalayan kingdom. The death toll in India's Uttar Pradesh state in the north rose to 783 yesterday, with 16 people dying the previous day. Most of the victims were children. But the disease appears to be on the wane in Nepal with the end of monsoon rains, said the health ministry in Kathmandu.
